parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version of the service to call. The current version is 1

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response

parameters.name: minLon
parameters.description: Minimum longitude coordinate of bounding box defined in terms of latitude/longitude.

parameters.name: minLat
parameters.description: Minimum latitude coordinate of bounding box defined in terms of latitude/longitude.

parameters.name: maxLon
parameters.description: Maximum longitude coordinate of bounding box defined in terms of latitude/longitude.

parameters.name: maxLat
parameters.description: Maximum latitude coordinate of bounding box defined in terms of latitude/longitude.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Specifies the jsonp callback method. Only used when format is jsonp.

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version of the service to call. The current version is 1

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description:
Zoom level of tile to be rendered. Only used for tile-level
copyright calls.

parameters.name: X
parameters.description:
X coordinate of the tile on zoom grid. Only used for tile-level
copyright calls.

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description:
Y coordinate of the tile on zoom grid. Only used for tile-level
copyright calls.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Specifies the jsonp callback method. Only used when format is jsonp.

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version of the service to call. The current version is 1.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: Layer of image to be rendered. Hybrid and labels are intended for layering with other data and are only available in png format.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Map style to be returned

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Image format to be returned

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: Zoom level of map image to be returned.

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Coordinates for the center point of the image. Must be used with the width and height parameters; cannot be used with bbox. Uses EPSG:3857 projection (functionally equivalent to EPSG:900910).

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the resulting image in pixels. Width must be a positive integer between 1 and 8192.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height of the resulting image in pixels. Height must be a positive integer between 1 and 8192.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Bounding box for the image, using EPSG:3857 projection (functionally equivalent to EPSG:900910). Values must be in the order of minLon, minLat, maxLon, maxLat. MaxLat must be greater than minLat. Longitude values can be on both sides of the 180th meridian. Cannot be used with center, width, or height parameters.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Geopolitical view. Determines rendering of disputed areas. See the documentation for an explanation of how this works in live services.

parameters.description: Version of the service to call. The current version is 1

parameters.description: Geopolitical view. Determines rendering of disputed areas. See the documentation for an explanation of how this works in live services.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language to be used for labels in the response. The default is NGT: Neutral Ground Truth, which uses each place's local official language and script (where available). See the documentation for a full list of options.

parameters.description: Layer of tile to be rendered. Hybrid and labels are intended for layering with other data and are only available in png format.

parameters.name: Y

parameters.name: format

parameters.name: tileSize
parameters.description: Tile dimensions in pixels. 512 is only available for the main style and basic or labels layers.

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version of the service to call. The current version is 1

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request type

parameters.name: srs
parameters.description: Projection used in describing the bbox EPSG:3857 is recommended, particularly at higher zoom levels. (Note that EPSG:3857 is functionally equivalent to EPSG:900913/EPSG:3785)

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Bounding box in the projection stated in srs (minLon,minLat,maxLon,maxLat)

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the resulting image, in pixels Maximum value is 2048

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height of the resulting image, in pixels Maximum value is 2048

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Image format to be returned

parameters.name: layers
parameters.description: Map layers requested Currently only the basic layer is available

parameters.name: styles
parameters.description:
Map styles to be returned. Currently, no styles are available. This
parameter is present for forward compatibility; it must be used and
left blank.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Your API key for calling this service.

apiDescription:
The Maps API web services suite offers the following APIs:
  - Raster
  The Maps Raster API renders map data that is divided into gridded sections called tiles. Tiles are square images (png or jpg format) in various sizes which are available at 19 different zoom levels, ranging from 0 to 20. For zoom level 0, the entire earth is displayed on one single tile, while at zoom level 20, the world is divided into 2<sup>40</sup> tiles.
  - Vector
  Similar to Maps Raster API, the Maps Vector API serves data on different zoom level ranging from 0 to 22. For zoom level 0, the entire earth is displayed on one single tile, while at zoom level 22, the world is divided into 2<sup>44</sup> tiles.
  The Maps Vector Service delivers geographic map data packaged in a vector representation of squared sections called vector tiles. Each tile includes pre-defined collections of map features (points, lines, road shapes, water polygons, building footprints, ect.) delivered in one of the specified vector formats. Format of the tile is formally described using protobuf schema.
